etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French farcin, from late Latin farciminum, from farcire ‘to stuff’ (because of the appearance of the swollen nodules)

definitions: glanders in horses (or a similar disease in cattle) in which there is inflammation of the lymph vessels, causing nodules (farcy buds or farcy buttons).
shortDefinitions: glanders in horses or similar disease in cattle in which there is inflammation of lymph vessels
